content: @Sarah Gaunt you have one broken link, to a cql file - can you comment on that?
also, lots of errors in ecr-bundle-knowledge-distribution.xml
That is all in @Kanwarpreet Sethi's stuff. It will be fixed before ballot deadline.
ok thx
kp hasn't got long... deadline is officially 24 hours away...
24 HOURS! I thought we had until midnight on the 19th? US time
that's what I ran
What does "that's what I ran" mean?
wrong topic. I should have said: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Ballot_Prep - 17th it is. But I actually made it 18th anyway
Great. I did not know that. I thought the final content deadline for the FHIR IGs was the same as the final content deadline in the HL7 publishing calendar.
it should be the same. I don't know why it's different
It's different because when we set the FHIR schedule back in May, you indicated you needed more time. HL7 publishing calendar is driven by V3/CDA timelines
Crap
I thought there was only one schedule
So it's Friday midnight - US time?
apparently we are not world class at communicating things to our editors
see https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/9-committers/subject/Ballot.20Freeze (which stream committers are required to keep up with...)

For some reason I thought that stream was about non-IG content.

So we have until midnight our time (AUS) on Sunday? Totally confused now.
officially 7pm
Sunday?
That's like 48 hours, not 24 hours. just means I can't go jetskiing tomorrow.. 29 here today!
you're just making me happy...
Ok, so to tell my US dudes - deadline is Sunday 19th August, 5am. Just to be clear.

@Sarah Gaunt this is weird:

-tx cache miss: $validate {urn:oid:1.0.3166.1#FJI: "Fiji"}: "null" for Include 1 codes from urn:oid:1.0.3166.1, Include 1 codes from urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.92, Include 1 codes from Include 1 codes from urn:oid:1.0.3166.1,
looks to me like this value set is wrong
What do you mean "wrong"?
well, why does it have so many includes with 1 code each? there should only be one include for each system...

It's this value set: https://phinvads.cdc.gov/vads/ViewValueSet.action?id=9CE75E17-176B-DE11-9B52-0015173D1785
I can fix it if it is wrong, but what is wrong with it?
where did you get the FHIR version from?
Oh - didn't know it mattered - that's just the export out of trifolia
well, it will render nicer for the reviewers. it doesn't mean anything different. @Sean McIlvenna should fix the trifolia export to be nice to revieweres
Hmmm, it may not be his fault - I had to add teh expansion I think - to get it to not error
you shouldn't need to do that, and I'm not sure you should anyway
What do you mean by "render nicer for reviewers" - it looks fine when I look at the value set page?
Or are you saying there should be 2 lists - one ofor each code system?
I had major problems with value sets - I was getting that "can't unmarshall" error - adding the expansion fixed that problem.
adding the expansion might hide the problem but it just kicks the can down the road. we
we'll leave it as is for now, but it would be better if we don't have explicit expansions next time
Ok - well I'll fix it in ballot then. I'll make a comment to fix it.
I need to figure out how to do value sets properly anyway - at least value sets that don't use a standard code system - I had nothing but problems with them.
so, @Sarah Gaunt I'm not seeing an actual list of changes anywhere in the ecr IG?
There is this: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/history.html
I guess I can add some more info to it - like point to the Gforge tracker...

well what I want to see is something like this: build.fhir.org/history.html - if somenone has read ecr before, what are the big things that have changed that they need to know about (without being downed by lots of tasks about typos etc)
also, a question from me that doesn't need putting in the guide: are the page names stable enough that a page comparison link is worthwhile? (like at the foot of every fhir page)
I changed the names of almost every profile, does that answer your question. They weren't meaningful enough for my liking in the for comment ballot.
well, that sure answers it.
that's a first good thing to put in the change notes...
I will knock something up - give me 30 mins
thanks
I don't suppose there a way to make this a bit easier to put together? - the only thing I've actually thought of is gettiong a download from GForge to at least start.
I'm looking for judgement from the editor here... anyone can go look in gforge and get overwhelmed... sorry

Ignoring the bad formatting - is this ok?
pasted image
yep that's the sort of thing I'm looking for

Most of the changes weren't based on GForge comments - they were aligning the FHIR with the published CDA IGs. And basically finishing off the FHIR IG - becuse the for comment one was just that "for comment" and not complete...
Ok will commit.
Why do I have changes in my txCache files, every single time I run a local build? (not an important question, just curious)
cause I haven't fully nailed the cache management yet. Getting close...
Cool
Committed history - let me know if you need anything else...
ok sure thanks
@Sarah Gaunt I still do not see any history notes...?
http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/case-reporting/history.html
The link is at the bottom of the page. In the footer
@Sarah Gaunt let me know if assigning v 0.2.0 to this publication is a problem
Nope! Assign away...

@Grahame Grieve our IG has a link that doesn't work. On this page: http://hl7.org/fhir/us/ecr/2018Sep/StructureDefinition-eicr-composition.html - this link: http://hl7.org/fhir/STU3profiling.html#representation

I tried this on another IG and it doesn't work either - is this an issue on your end or on our end?
Also, are we allowed to make any minor changes - we have noticed something and would like to add a paragraph to explain so that people don't get the the wrong end of the stick...
only if it's desparately wrong
freeze was a long time ago
I know... Client thinks it is desperately wrong! It would just be one sentence explaining something...
What about that bad link - it's on every profile page...
it's in the source ig
where else did you see it?
Just randomly picked another build: http://build.fhir.org/ig/udaychandrupatla/au-fhir-base/StructureDefinition-au-medication.html

It is this in sd.html: '''<a href="{{site.data.fhir.path}}profiling.html#representation">Description of Profiles, Differentials, and Snapshots</a>'''

I've just checked VhDir and that works in that IG, but not in ours? (I looked at their sd.html and the href is exactly the same)
Only difference I can see is that VhDir is R4 and ECR is R3?
it's a bug in the IG publisher. no one has picked it up before
difference is in the spec path in the ig.json file
Ok - is it something that is fixable before this goes out to the commenters - they will pick it up for sure and make a billion comments on it! :joy:
